summary: The FEMA Independence Act of 2025 proposes to establish the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) as a cabinet-level, independent agency. It outlines the responsibilities, authority, and personnel structure of the new agency. The bill addresses the Director's role, deputy directors, and regional offices. It also includes sections on transferring functions, personnel, and assets, while addressing existing legal documents and actions. Conforming amendments to other laws, a report on recommended legislation, and key definitions are included.
